New Records: Brayan Rocchio hit his eighth home run of the season, his first since August 20.
Rocchio drove in a career-high four runs with an RBI sacrifice fly and a bases-loaded walk, reaching 31 RBI for the season.
Tanner Bibee struck out six batters and allowed one run over six innings in a strong performance.
Key Match Events: Rocchio attempted a bunt but failed, leading to a big hit for a home run.
Cleveland's bullpen threw three scoreless innings after Bibee's exit.
Bibee retired Salvador Perez on a line out to left field and struck out MJ Melendez to end the sixth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Stephen Vogt praised Rocchio's resilience after a failed bunt attempt.
Vogt mentioned the Guardians' strong position with 23 games remaining and a magic number to clinch the division.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians have a magic number of 14 to clinch a playoff spot.
The Royals' seventh straight loss contributed to their struggles.
Others: Guardians starters have performed well in their last four games, allowing no more than one earned run each.
